questions.question: They broke ......................... over a silly fight.
questions.description: To break up is to end a relationship.

questions.question: The prisoners who broke ................................. of prison have been caught.
questions.description: To break out of prison is to escape.

questions.question: The sad news brought me ...........................
questions.description: To bring somebody down is to make them unhappy.

questions.question: His uncle brought him ............................ after his parents died.
questions.description: To bring somebody up is to raise them.

questions.question: My wife walked out of the room when I brought ............................... politics.
questions.description: To bring up a topic is to start discussing it.

questions.question: I had an upset stomach and brought ............................ my lunch in the wash room.
questions.description: To bring up food is to vomit it.

questions.question: Ask him to call me ............................ when he returns.
questions.description: To call somebody back is to return a phone call.

questions.question: Susie called the wedding ........................ when she realized that Jack was in a relationship with another woman.
questions.description: To call off wedding is to cancel it.

questions.question: Janet called .......................... yesterday but I wasn't home.
questions.description: To call on somebody is to visit them.

questions.question: Although I ran fast, I could not catch ......................... with them.
questions.description: To catch up with somebody is to get to the same point as they are.

questions.question: She cheered ............................ when she heard that she had passed the exam.
If everyone chips ............................ we can finish the job by evening.
questions.description: To chip in is to help or contribute.
